item.description:
For those of you who had previously looked at this meetup, please note that I have changed the time from 3:00 to 5:30.

Riverview Park is a park in Grafton with a soccer field and 2 boat launch areas.  The park is behind the Riverview Apartments at 174 Providence Road (Route 122), Grafton.

Important: Follow the road into the park (past the apartments on your right) and when you get to what looks like the end of the road (you'll see water on your left),  take a right (head toward a port-a-potty) and follow the dirt road along the edge of the soccer field.  There is a launch at the end of that road.

We'll launch into Fisherville Pond and from there we can explore the pond and parts of the Blackstone River.  Here's a link to a description and map of the area:

http://zaptheblackstone.org/whatyoushouldknow/Publications/Quinsigamond_Rec_Guide.pdf

I would guestimate 2 hours on the water. I expect to see a decent amount of wildlife as much of the area is in its natural state with evidence of muskrats, beaver and many birds.

Please arrive in time to be in your kayak and ready to paddle at 5:30 PM.

***PLEASE NOTE*** The organizers in this group are NOT trained leaders or instructors.  The organizers only set the time and place, each person participating in any group trip is responsible for their own safety.  Each participant is responsible for evaluating all relevant conditions for the trip and determining if their skills and equipment are appropriate for those conditions.

Required: PFD (worn), whistle, headlamp/flashlight if our near/after sunset.

Optional/recommended: pump/bailer, insect repellent, sunscreen, water, snack, change of clothes in drybag, hat with brim/visor and sunglasses.
item.name: Paddle Fisherville Pond, Grafton
